dt: {bc}to take or seize by or as if by a sudden motion or grasp
{bc}to obtain without consideration of what is right or wrong

pt: {sc}take{/sc} {sc}seize{/sc} {sc}grasp{/sc} {sc}clutch{/sc} {sc}snatch{/sc} {sc}grab{/sc} mean to get hold of by or as if by catching up with the hand. {sc}take{/sc} is a general term applicable to any manner of getting something into one's possession or control.
{sc}seize{/sc} implies a sudden and forcible movement in getting hold of something tangible or an apprehending of something fleeting or elusive when intangible.
{sc}grasp{/sc} stresses a laying hold so as to have firmly in possession.
{sc}clutch{/sc} suggests avidity or anxiety in seizing or grasping and may imply less success in holding.
{sc}snatch{/sc} suggests more suddenness or quickness but less force than {sc}seize{/sc}.
{sc}grab{/sc} implies more roughness or rudeness than {sc}snatch{/sc}.

shortdef: to take or seize by or as if by a sudden motion or grasp
